shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 3ra-19va) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 19vb-45rb) III) Anaphoras (fols. 45va-129va)
Additiones 1-3.

copyists.copyist: Gäbrä Maryam is mentioned as the scribe in the supplication formula on fol. 58vb. His name is written in the main hand.

donors.donor: Additiones 1-3 mention Mänbärä Śǝllase as the donor. Her name is also inserted in a secondary hand in deep brown ink in the supplication formulas, sometimes interlineally, e.g., on fols. 6rb, 18rb, 95va, 110vb, 121va. The names of her parents are mentioned in Additio 1 and are also inserted in the supplication formulas, in the same hand, or interlineally: Wäldä Ḥawaryat (fols. 55rb, 95va, 116ra) and Wälättä Rufaʾel (fols. 86rb, 121va).

txstates.txstate: The sewing is partly missing; almost all quires are unbound. The back board is broken and has been repaired with a thread of plastic and metal wire. The Ms. shows traces of intensive use. Many leaves are badly stained with wax and dirt (e.g., fols. 20v, 26r, 31r, 51r-v). Text is barely legible or illegible on some leaves, e.g., fols. 27r, 54v, 57ra, 75ra. The Ms. is damaged by rodents in the bottom margin of fols. 1-10; by fire, e.g., on fols. 32, 38, 53, 78, with loss of text. Remains of glues are preserved on the inner side of left board. Fol. 131 is a leaf of different size originating from another (somewhat older) Ms. Tears amended on fols. 95, 121.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and to the tail of the codex.

inks.ink: Black (dark grey on fols. 55va, 56rb), strong red.

squires.squire:
A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fols. 11r-19v) – III(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fols. 20r-28v) – IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) – V(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fols. 37r-45v) – VI(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fols. 46r-54v) – VII(7; s.l.: 5, stub after 2/fols. 55r-61r) – VIII(8/fols. 62r-69v) – IX(10/fols. 70r-79v) – X(10/fols. 80r-89v) – XI(8/fols. 90r-97v) – XII(10/fols. 98r-107v) – XIII(9; s.l.: 6, stub after 3/fols. 108r-116v) – XIV(9; s.l.: 3, stub after 7/fols. 117r-125v) – XV(6+1; s.l.: {6}, stub after 1/fols. 126-132v).
Fol. 131 is a leaf of different origin, inserted into quire XV.

taunit.rl-info:
Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The scribe did not use two top ruled lines on fol. 3v and one bottom ruled line on fols. 41rb and 41va. The scribe wrote under the bottom ruled line on fols. 3vb, 67ra. One additional vertical line has been ruled on fol. 38. Fol. 75v has two additional bottom ruled lines not used by the scribe.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the scribe; directives for the ministers or their abbreviations; some of the musical notation signs above the lines; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I and III; two groups of lines on the incipit page of Text II; initial two lines or groups of lines (alternating with black lines) of subsections of Texts I, II, III.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይቤ፡ ካህን፡ (e.g., fols. 3rb, 33va, 58ra, 129rb) ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይቤ፡ ሕዝብ፡ (e.g., fols. 3rb, 27va, 63vb, 126vb) ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይቤ፡ ዲያቆን፡ (e.g., fols. 8va, 28ra, 70rb, 101rb) ቡ፡/ቡራ፡ for ቡራኬ፡ (e.g., fols. 18vb, 27ra, 46rb, 74ra) ቅድ፡ ቤ፡ ክ፡ for ቅድስት፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ (fol. 24rb) እ፡ for እምዝ፡ (e.g., fols. 26va, 29ra) ናስ፡ ከመ፡ እግ፡/ና፡ ከ፡ እ፡ for ናስተበቍዕ፡ ከመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ (e.g., fols. 30vb, 31ra, 31vb) በ፡/በእ፡/በእን፡ for በእንተ፡ (e.g., fols. 30vb, 31va) ወለ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡/ወለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አሜን፡ for ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fols. 55rb, 100rb) እማ፡ for እማሬ፡ (e.g., fols. 57ra, 72va, 78ra) ቅ፡ ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ (e.g., fols. 101rb, 103vb, 117vb, 127rb) አ፡ አ፡ for አሜን፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 104va, 105rb, 112rb, 119rb) እግ፡ ተሠ፡ for አግዚኦ፡ ተሠሃለነ፡ (fol. 105vb) ለመ፡ ዓለ፡ for ለመድኃኔ፡ ዓለም፡ (e.g., fols. 109va, 115ra, 120va, 129ra).

additional.det: The note is written in deep brown ink and states that Mänbärä Śǝllase donated this book to Mikaʾel Bet Mäkwaʿ during the tenure of Ṣotä Śǝllase. Her father Wäldä Ḥawaryat and her mother Wälättä Rufaʾel are also mentioned.

additional.cont: Fol. 45rb: Donation note.
additional.det: The note is crudely written in dark grey ink and states that Mänbärä Śǝllase donated this book to Mikaʾel Bet Mukwǝʿ during the tenure of Ṣotä Śǝllase.

additional.cont: Fol. 129va: Donation note.
additional.det: The note is written in deep brown ink, possibly in the same hand as Additio 1. It states that Mänbärä Śǝllase donated this book to Mikaʾel Bet Mäkwaʿ during the tenure of Ṣotä Śǝllase.

extras.extra: - Texts I, II, III contain musical notation signs. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of two perpendicular lines (┴), indicating the place where the omissions, written in the upper margin, belong: fols. 8rb, 87vb, 126ra, 128ra. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 16vb, 26rb, 62va, 65ra, 68va. - Omitted words added at the end of the line in small script: fols. 62va, 124rb. - Immediate corrections indicated by series of dashes above and below the letters or the words: fols. 13ra, 22va, 83va, 89ra, 124rb. - Corrections indicated by two lines in black ink over the word: fols. 10rb, 59ra, 98va. - Lacunae (spaces for names left unfilled) on many leaves: e.g., fols. 7vb, 14vb, 30va, 41vb, 59rb, 95va. - Numbers are written in red ink in the left margin of fols. 6va, 7ra (here also in the intercolumn), 74ra (here also in black ink), 85va (here also in black ink). - Pen trial: fols. 1r, 1v, 132r. - Scribbles: fols. 3r, 9ra, 33va, 69v, 130r. - Prayers and other minor texts are crudely written in dark grey ink, possibly in the same hand as Additio 2, on fols. 2r, 2vb (here effaced), 129v, 130r, 130v, 132r, 132v. One of the prayers on fol. 129vb mentions the date 1903 year of mercy (= 1911 AD). - A prayer with musical notation signs is written, possibly in the main hand, on fol. 2va. - Fol. 131 originates from a Mäṣḥafä Täklil “Book of the Marriage Ritual”. - Note almost illegible in deep brown ink on fol. 55vb.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Daily readings of Text I are indicated by the names of the days of the week crudely written in the upper margin, in a recent secondary hand in blue ink: ዘሰኑይ፡ fol. 11vb ዘሰሉስ፡ fol. 12rb ዘረቡዕ፡ fol. 12vb ዘሐሙስ፡ fol. 13rb ዘዓርብ፡ fol. 13vb ዘቀዳም፡ fol. 14ra ዘእሁድ፡ fol. 14va.

drawing.details: - Fol. 130v: St. Michael, deep brown ink.

frames.frame: - Fol. 3r (incipit page of Text I): coloured (deep vermilion, strong orange, outlined in black) ornamental band; crosses, interlaces.
